alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 25 at 12:49PM PST until January 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet with dangerous rip currents expected. Highest across west- facing beaches. Minor coastal flooding during morning high tides. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. Pooling of sea water is expected around the time of high tide over sandy beach areas including bike paths and walkways. Significant damage is NOT expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides will peak near 6.4 to 6.7 feet each morning between 830 AM and 930 AM.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
